other_tests.findings: Intraepidermal blistering consistent with pemphigus vulgaris.
Granulomatous inflammation with multinucleated giant cells and numerous yeast-form microorganisms characteristic of cryptococcal infection.
CSF total protein level of 56 mg per deciliter, glucose level of 95 mg per deciliter, 13 white cells predominantly lymphocytes, and CSF cryptococcal-antigen test positive at 1:1024.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Repeat CSF examination after treatment showed decreased white-cell count and sterile culture.

other_tests.findings: Performed as part of lung evaluation; specific findings not detailed.
Involvement of the vocal cords with pemphigus.
Glucosuria (glucose level greater than 1000 mg per deciliter), trace amounts of blood, and presence of red cells, bacteria and epithelial cells.
